intro: Leucobotrys adpressa, commonly known as the flat-leaved milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has a low-growing habit with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is typically found in open, sunny habitats. Leucobotrys adpressa is part of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap.
